Infectious Diseases.Name: Bacterial Food Poisoning
Infectious Diseases.Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea and watery stools, accompanied by fever, etc.
Infectious Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Acute bacterial dysentery, cholera, acute hemorrhagic necrotizing enteritis, viral gastroenteritis, pufferfish poisoning, poliomyelitis, etc.

Infectious Diseases.Name: Hepatitis A
Infectious Diseases.Symptoms: Fatigue, loss of appetite, enlarged liver, abnormal liver function
Infectious Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Other types of viral hepatitis, toxic hepatitis

Parasitic Diseases.Name: Malaria
Parasitic Diseases.Symptoms: The main symptoms of malaria are chills, high fever, sweating, headache, limb aches, and fatigue. After a certain incubation period, the symptoms recur. Severe cases can lead to complications such as anemia, hypoglycemia, acute renal failure, or acute pulmonary edema.
Parasitic Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Malaria should be differentiated from various febrile diseases such as sepsis, typhoid, leptospirosis, hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome, schistosomiasis, biliary tract infections, and urinary tract infections. When it develops into cerebral malaria, it should be differentiated from Japanese encephalitis, moderate bacillary dysentery, sporadic viral encephalitis, etc.

Parasitic Diseases.Name: Acute Schistosomiasis
Parasitic Diseases.Symptoms: The main symptoms of schistosomiasis are fever, gastrointestinal symptoms (often dysenteric stools, which may be bloody and mucous), hepatosplenomegaly, and pulmonary symptoms (cough is quite common, there may be chest pain, blood-stained sputum, etc.).
Parasitic Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Sepsis, malaria, typhoid and paratyphoid fever, acute miliary tuberculosis, viral infections, other intestinal diseases

Malignant Tumors.Name: Nasopharyngeal Malignancy
Malignant Tumors.Symptoms: Tinnitus, hearing loss, nasal congestion, blood in nasal discharge, headache, facial numbness, double vision, neck lumps.
Malignant Tumors.Differential Diagnosis: Nasopharyngeal angiofibroma, lymphadenitis, malignant lymphoma, nasopharyngeal tuberculosis, proliferative lesions

Malignant Tumors.Name: Esophageal Malignancy
Malignant Tumors.Symptoms: Dysphagia (difficulty swallowing or feeling of obstruction when food moves down the esophagus, initially for solid food, later for semi-solid food, and finally for liquid food and saliva, indicating a progressive malignant course rather than spasm, benign or digestive strictures); chest pain often radiating to the back.
Malignant Tumors.Differential Diagnosis: Benign esophageal stricture, achalasia, esophageal diverticulum, esophageal tuberculosis, etc.

Benign, In Situ, and Uncertain Neoplasms.Name: Uterine Fibroids
Benign, In Situ, and Uncertain Neoplasms.Symptoms: Uterine bleeding, abdominal mass, vaginal discharge, pressure symptoms
Benign, In Situ, and Uncertain Neoplasms.Differential Diagnosis: Adenomyosis, ovarian tumors, uterine sarcoma, endometrial cancer, cervical cancer, pelvic inflammatory mass, uterine malformations, pregnancy uterus.

Benign, In Situ, and Uncertain Neoplasms.Name: Growth Hormone Adenoma (GH Adenoma)
Benign, In Situ, and Uncertain Neoplasms.Symptoms: Excessive secretion of growth hormone. Patients who have not reached adulthood may experience rapid growth, even developing into giants. In adults, acromegaly is manifested as changes in facial features, enlarged forehead, protruding jaw, large nose and lips, thick fingers, feeling of tightness in shoes and hats, increased appetite, coarse hair and skin, pigmentation, numbness of fingers, etc. Severe cases may experience general fatigue, headaches, joint pain, decreased sexual function, amenorrhea, infertility, and even diabetes.
Benign, In Situ, and Uncertain Neoplasms.Differential Diagnosis: Paget's disease of bone, leontiasis ossea, ectopic growth hormone-releasing factor syndrome.

Endocrine, Nutritional, and Metabolic Di.Name: Hyperthyroidism
Endocrine, Nutritional, and Metabolic Di.Symptoms: Irritability, restlessness, tachycardia, fatigue, heat intolerance, sweating, weight loss, increased appetite, increased bowel movements or diarrhea, scanty menstruation
Endocrine, Nutritional, and Metabolic Di.Differential Diagnosis: Destructive thyrotoxicosis, exogenous thyroid hormone intake, simple goiter, hypothyroidism, hyperparathyroidism.

Diseases of the Blood and Blood-Forming.Name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
Diseases of the Blood and Blood-Forming.Symptoms: Pallor (due to a lack of oxygenated hemoglobin in the skin or mucous membranes), fatigue, dizziness, weakness, pica, etc.
Diseases of the Blood and Blood-Forming.Differential Diagnosis: Sideroblastic anemia (manifests as microcytic anemia, but with increased serum ferritin levels, increased iron granules in bone marrow sideroblasts, increased sideroblasts, and the appearance of ring sideroblasts.), Thalassemia (with a family history. Hemolytic manifestations. A large number of target cells can be seen in the blood film.), Transferrin deficiency (autosomal recessive inheritance (congenital) or secondary to severe liver disease, tumors (acquired).)

Diseases of the Blood and Blood-Forming.Name: Thalassemia
Diseases of the Blood and Blood-Forming.Symptoms: Anemia, decreased physical strength, iron deposition in organs, changes in skull shape, hepatosplenomegaly, protruding abdomen
Diseases of the Blood and Blood-Forming.Differential Diagnosis: Iron deficiency anemia, megaloblastic anemia, neonatal jaundice.

Mental Disorders.Name: Schizophrenia
Mental Disorders.Symptoms: Hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking, abnormal emotional responses, social withdrawal, slow responses
Mental Disorders.Differential Diagnosis: Schizotypal personality disorder, depression, metabolic diseases.

Mental Disorders.Name: Depression
Mental Disorders.Symptoms: Low mood, loss of interest, low self-esteem, self-blame, suicidal thoughts
Mental Disorders.Differential Diagnosis: Depression related to physical illness, dementia, schizophrenia, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), bipolar depression.

Diseases of the Nervous System.Name: Epidemic Cerebrospinal Meningitis
Diseases of the Nervous System.Symptoms: Early stage: fever, headache, sore throat, increased upper respiratory secretions, runny nose, cough, etc. Severe: sudden high fever, severe headache, projectile vomiting, neck stiffness, skin petechiae, incontinence, coma, convulsions, etc.
Diseases of the Nervous System.Differential Diagnosis: Japanese encephalitis (no bacteremia stage, no skin petechiae, less likely to have sudden shock), common cold.

Diseases of the Nervous System.Name: Parkinson's Disease
Diseases of the Nervous System.Symptoms: Motor symptoms: tremors, rigidity of limbs, slow movement, instability in posture; Non-motor symptoms: presence of constipation, olfactory disorders, sleep disorders, autonomic dysfunction, and mental and cognitive impairments
Diseases of the Nervous System.Differential Diagnosis: Parkinson's Plus Syndromes that occur with other neurodegenerative diseases (overall less frequent occurrence of resting tremor), Essential Tremor (postural/action tremor as the only manifestation), Depression (lack of facial expression, monotonous speech, without rigidity and tremor)

Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa.Name: Glaucoma
Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa.Symptoms: Blurred vision, headache, eye swelling, eye pain, nausea, vomiting, foggy vision, unequal pupil sizes, decreased vision
Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa.Differential Diagnosis: Acute angle-closure glaucoma acute attack, accompanied by severe headache, nausea, vomiting, etc., may be misdiagnosed as acute gastroenteritis and neurological diseases; acute iridocyclitis, acute conjunctivitis.

Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa.Name: Cataract
Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa.Symptoms: Blurry, foggy vision, decreased visual acuity, decreased contrast sensitivity, blurry vision, monocular double or multiple vision, visual field defects, glare
Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa.Differential Diagnosis: Glaucoma, age-related macular degeneration, physiological lens aging.

Diseases of the Ear and Mastoid Process.Name: Chronic Otitis Media
Diseases of the Ear and Mastoid Process.Symptoms: Ear discharge, hearing loss, tinnitus, dizziness, vomiting, facial paralysis, severe headache, chills, high fever, etc.
Diseases of the Ear and Mastoid Process.Differential Diagnosis: Chronic tympanitis, middle ear cancer, tuberculous otitis media.

Diseases of the Ear and Mastoid Process.Name: Mastoiditis
Diseases of the Ear and Mastoid Process.Symptoms: Swelling, redness of the skin over the mastoid process, significant tenderness, redness, collapse with purulent discharge, cloudy air cells, presenting a cloudy appearance, etc.
Diseases of the Ear and Mastoid Process.Differential Diagnosis: Otitis media, ear boils, mumps, temporomandibular joint disease, etc.

Circulatory System Diseases.Name: Acute Rheumatic Fever
Circulatory System Diseases.Symptoms: Fever, migratory arthritis, carditis, erythema marginatum, chorea, etc.

Circulatory System Diseases.Name: Varicose Veins of the Lower Leg
Circulatory System Diseases.Symptoms: The affected limb often feels sour, heavy, swollen, and painful, and is prone to fatigue and weakness; the superficial veins of the affected limb are raised, dilated, and become tortuous, even winding or in lumps, which is more obvious when standing
Circulatory System Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Post-thrombotic syndrome of the lower limbs (Doppler ultrasound suggests poor blood reflux in the deep veins, with simultaneous blood backflow. Lower limb venography shows rough deep vein walls, and the venous lumen is irregularly narrowed), Budd-Chiari Syndrome (enlarged spleen, large and stubborn ascites), Klippel-Trenaunay Syndrome (limb growth, thickening, abnormally large and tortuous superficial veins, and the triad of cutaneous hemangioma)

Respiratory System Diseases.Name: Asthma
Respiratory System Diseases.Symptoms: Wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, chest oppression, and shortness of breath recur intermittently
Respiratory System Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Allergic rhinitis, sinusitis, foreign body aspiration, tracheal stenosis, laryngotracheomalacia

Digestive System Diseases.Name: Peptic Ulcer
Digestive System Diseases.Symptoms: Upper abdominal pain, acid reflux, heartburn, etc.
Digestive System Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Gastric cancer, chronic gastritis, gastric neurosis, cholecystitis, cholelithiasis, gastrinoma.

Digestive System Diseases.Name: Intestinal Obstruction
Digestive System Diseases.Symptoms: Intermittent abdominal colic, decreased appetite, constipation, vomiting, inability to pass stool or flatus, abdominal distension
Digestive System Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Acute perforation of gastric or duodenal ulcer (usually with a history of long-term digestive tract ulcers), acute cholecystitis complicated by gallbladder stones, acute pancreatitis, acute appendicitis (fixed point tenderness in the lower right abdomen)

Diseases of the Genitourinary System.Name: Urinary Tract Stones
Diseases of the Genitourinary System.Symptoms: Pain, hematuria, frequent urination, urgency, fever, chills

Diseases of the Genitourinary System.Name: Acute Pyelonephritis
Diseases of the Genitourinary System.Symptoms: Fever and chills, nausea and vomiting, unilateral or bilateral back pain, frequent urination, urgency, and pain
Diseases of the Genitourinary System.Differential Diagnosis: Acute cystitis, cholecystitis, pancreatitis, pelvic inflammatory disease; in cases with high fever but no obvious urinary symptoms, differentiation should be made from various febrile diseases

Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperiu.Name: Pregnancy-Induced Hypertension Syndrome
Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperiu.Differential Diagnosis: Chronic hypertension, preeclampsia, chronic hypertension with superimposed preeclampsia.

Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperiu.Name: Pregnancy Complicated by Hyperthyroidism
Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperiu.Symptoms: Palpitations, tachycardia, excessive sweating, irritability, increased appetite, fatigue, goiter, exophthalmos, etc.
Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperiu.Differential Diagnosis: Simple goiter during pregnancy, subacute thyroiditis, Hashimoto's disease

Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Name: Dermatitis
Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Symptoms: Skin rashes, papules, blisters, lichenification, etc.
Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Differential Diagnosis: Atopic dermatitis, contact dermatitis, seborrheic dermatitis, stasis dermatitis, neurodermatitis, superficial fungal infections, scabies, polymorphic light eruption, eosinophilia syndrome, pellagra, etc.

Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Name: Furuncle
Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Symptoms: Superficial skin infection by fire poison, local redness, swelling, heat, and pain, acute suppuration
Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Differential Diagnosis: Carbuncle (with multiple honeycomb-like purulent plugs on the surface), folliculitis (similar to a furuncle but without purulent plugs), infected sebaceous cyst, acne with mild infection

Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Symptoms: Morning stiffness, arthritis of hands, feet, wrists, ankles, temporomandibular joints, joint deformities
Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Differential Diagnosis: Ankylosing spondylitis, osteoarthritis, gout, psoriatic arthritis.

Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Name: Acute Osteomyelitis
Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Symptoms: Bone pain, difficulty in walking, local redness and swelling, etc.
Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Differential Diagnosis: Osteosarcoma (bone destruction, periosteal reaction is relatively limited in scope), Ewing's Sarcoma (the periosteal reaction is regular compared to osteomyelitis, mostly in the form of onion-skin periosteal reaction), Osteitis Fibrosa Cystica, Osteoid Osteoma

Congenital Anomalies.Name: Congenital Heart Disease
Congenital Anomalies.Symptoms: Repeated respiratory infections, palpitations, shortness of breath, cyanosis, etc.
Congenital Anomalies.Differential Diagnosis: Rheumatic heart disease, anemia, venous hum, common cold.

Congenital Anomalies.Name: Favism
Congenital Anomalies.Symptoms: Hemolysis occurs within 1 to 2 days after consuming fresh fava beans, accompanied by general malaise, fatigue, chills, fever, dizziness, headache, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain
Congenital Anomalies.Differential Diagnosis: Infectious anemia, hemolytic anemia, thalassemia, hereditary spherocytosis

Conditions Originating in the Perinatal.Name: Neonatal Tetanus
Conditions Originating in the Perinatal.Symptoms: Crying, limited mouth opening, difficulty sucking

Conditions Originating in the Perinatal.Name: Neonatal Pneumonia due to Amniotic Fluid Aspiration
Conditions Originating in the Perinatal.Symptoms: Difficult breathing and cyanosis occur immediately after resuscitation, with the possibility of fluid or foam flowing out from the mouth, and moist rales auscultated in the lungs
Conditions Originating in the Perinatal.Differential Diagnosis: Meconium Aspiration Pneumonia (rapid and shallow breathing (>60 breaths per minute), nasal flaring, three-groove sign, moaning, and cyanosis appear immediately after resuscitation), Milk Aspiration Pneumonia (sudden cessation of breathing, cyanosis, or choking cough after breastfeeding, with milk aspirated from the airway)
